title: Get a user

parameters.description: Identifies which additional information you'd like to receive about the person's hovercard. Can be organization, repository, issue, pull_request. Required when using subject_id.
parameters.name: subject_type

parameters.description: Uses the ID for the subject_type you specified. Required when using subject_type.
parameters.name: subject_id

title: Get contextual information for a user
List users blocked by the authenticated user
Check if a user is blocked by the authenticated user
Block a user
Unblock a user

parameters.description: Required. Specify the primary email address that needs a visibility change.
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: Required. Use public to enable an authenticated user to view the specified email address, or use private so this primary email address cannot be seen publicly.
parameters.name: visibility

title: Set primary email visibility for the authenticated user

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

title: List email addresses for the authenticated user

parameters.description: Required. Adds one or more email addresses to your GitHub account. Must contain at least one email address. Note: Alternatively, you can pass a single email address or an array of emails addresses directly, but we recommend that you pass an object using the emails key.
parameters.name: emails

title: Add an email address for the authenticated user

parameters.description: Required. Deletes one or more email addresses from your GitHub account. Must contain at least one email address. Note: Alternatively, you can pass a single email address or an array of emails addresses directly, but we recommend that you pass an object using the emails key.
parameters.name: emails

title: Delete an email address for the authenticated user

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

title: List public email addresses for the authenticated user

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

title: List followers of the authenticated user

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

title: List the people the authenticated user follows
Check if a person is followed by the authenticated user
Follow a user
Unfollow a user

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

title: List followers of a user

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

title: List the people a user follows
Check if a user follows another user

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page

title: List public SSH keys for the authenticated user

parameters.description: A descriptive name for the new key. Use a name that will help you recognize this key in your GitHub account. For example, if you're using a personal Mac, you might call this key "Personal MacBook Air".
parameters.name: title

parameters.description: The public SSH key to add to your GitHub account. See "Generating a new SSH key" for guidance on how to create a public SSH key.
parameters.name: key

title: Create a public SSH key for the authenticated user
Get a public SSH key for the authenticated user
Delete a public SSH key for the authenticated user

parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.
parameters.name: page
